head.title: A Lesson for China In an Israeli Decision

hedline.hl1: A Lesson for China In an Israeli Decision

abstract.p: William F Hewitt letter congratulates Israel for canceling sale of airborne radar system to China and says decision teaches Chinese leadership it will not have carte blanche anymore to run roughshod over its own people or conquered peoples (S)

block.p: Re ''Israel Drops Plan to Sell Air Radar to China Military'' (front page, July 13):

Israel is to be congratulated on its decision to cancel the sale of an airborne radar system to China. The decision teaches the Chinese leadership that it will not have carte blanche anymore from the democracies to run roughshod over its own people or over conquered peoples in Tibet, Inner Mongolia and East Turkestan, or to threaten the free people of Taiwan.
Re ''Israel Drops Plan to Sell Air Radar to China Military'' (front page, July 13):

Israel is to be congratulated on its decision to cancel the sale of an airborne radar system to China. The decision teaches the Chinese leadership that it will not have carte blanche anymore from the democracies to run roughshod over its own people or over conquered peoples in Tibet, Inner Mongolia and East Turkestan, or to threaten the free people of Taiwan.

Israel's cancellation of the deal should also be viewed in tandem with a recent development at the World Bank. Bowing to international pressure from governments and human rights and environmental groups, the World Bank denied financing for a Chinese project that would have resettled Chinese farmers in an area that nomadic Tibetan herdsmen once dominated (news article, July 8). Rather than face a review that the bank required for the project to be reconsidered, China withdrew its request.
WILLIAM F. HEWITT New York, July 13, 2000
